column1: 26282FC3-922B-46BE-9AFA-CB7F752A7594#appfire#F35EF62E-E6BF-4A97-98B5-D9F3FFCF003F#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-06 15:24:26.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-06 15:24:26.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#92DD7C40-DF61-49B6-9006-524126C326A8#appfire#F35EF62E-E6BF-4A97-98B5-D9F3FFCF003F#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-06 15:24:26.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-06 15:24:26.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#DE927ABE-A6DE-42BF-B1AB-569985B67676#appfire#F35EF62E-E6BF-4A97-98B5-D9F3FFCF003F#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-06 15:24:26.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-06 15:24:26.0#appfire#1
